intro: Linosyris crassifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved linosyris, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features thick, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in arid environments. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Linosyris crassifolia is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to full sun exposure.
